value.title: Power BI Datamart vs Dataflow vs Dataset
value.excerpt: Datamart, Dataflow, and Dataset are all Power BI components dealing with the data. I have presented about these a lot, and one of the questions I get is: What is the difference between Dataflow, Dataset, and Datamart? So I thought to explain it in a video and help everyone in that understanding. In this
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Biz-s-YoKRc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI REST API; What it is and Why it is Important
value.excerpt: You can interact with the Power BI objects in the Power BI Service through a set of APIs called Power BI REST API. The Power BI REST API can help automate tasks, build tools that work with Power BI, the configuration of Power BI outside of the platform, and embed Power BI into a third-party application.

value.title: Filter Context in DAX
value.excerpt: Understanding the difference between a row context and a filter context is the first and most important concept to learn to use DAX correctly. This video introduces the filter context. Article and download: https://sql.bi/747800?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The

value.title: Filter top 3 products with a row for others using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video shows an optimized DAX technique to display the first N products for each category in Power BI, adding a row that aggregates the value for all the other products. Article and download: https://sql.bi/695263/?aff=yt  The article includes further insights and optimization solutions, whereas

value.title: Reading active Power BI security roles in DAX
value.excerpt: How to read the active security roles in a Tabular model for Power BI or Analysis Services by using a DAX measure. This way, you can use measures and calculation groups to customize a report based dynamically on security roles active for the current user. Article and download: https://sql.bi/803102?aff=yt

value.title: Analyze data with Power BI
value.excerpt: This module goes beyond viewing and exploring your content and explains how to interact with it by working with reports and dashboards to uncover and share new business insights.

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data​
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data​

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Introduction to end-to-end analytics using Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Discover how Microsoft Fabric can meet your enterprise's analytics needs in one platform. Discover the capabilities Fabric has to offer, understand how it works, and identify how you can use Fabric for your analytics needs.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.
